main event: A white, circular light object was observed in the sky over Englewood, Ohio on July 2, 1963.
interesting points: The object moved around in the southwest sky with a red flashing light, appearing like a moving aerial object.
The object faded and flickered, and was described as dark with no sound.
The object was initially evaluated as an observation of the star Antares.
The witness saw the object for about 10 minutes and it remained stationary in the southwest sky.
The witness described the object as brighter than a star.
